org.apache.hawq.pxf.api

Class FragmentsStats

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.hawq.pxf.api.FragmentsStats

  • public class FragmentsStats
extends java.lang.Object
    FragmentsStats holds statistics for a given path.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      class  FragmentsStats.SizeAndUnit
      Container for size and unit
      static class  FragmentsStats.SizeUnit
      Enum to represent unit (Bytes/KB/MB/GB/TB)

    • Field Summary

    • Field Detail

      • DEFAULT_FRAGMENT_SIZE

        public static final long DEFAULT_FRAGMENT_SIZE
        Default fragment size. Assuming a fragment is equivalent to a block in HDFS, we guess a full fragment size is 64MB.
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

    • Constructor Detail

      • FragmentsStats

        public FragmentsStats(long fragmentsNumber,
                      long firstFragmentSize,
                      long totalSize)
        Constructs an FragmentsStats.
        Parameters:
        fragmentsNumber - number of fragments
        firstFragmentSize - first fragment size (in bytes)
        totalSize - total size (in bytes)

    • Method Detail

      • dataToJSON

        public static java.lang.String dataToJSON(FragmentsStats stats)
                                   throws java.io.IOException
        Given a FragmentsStats, serialize it in JSON to be used as the result string for HAWQ. An example result is as follows: {"PXFFragmentsStats":{"fragmentsNumber":3,"firstFragmentSize":{"size"=67108864,"unit":"B"},"totalSize":{"size"=200000000,"unit"="B"}}}
        Parameters:
        stats - the data to be serialized
        Returns:
        the result in json format
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if converting to JSON format failed

      • dataToString

        public static java.lang.String dataToString(FragmentsStats stats,
                                            java.lang.String datapath)
        Given a stats structure, convert it to be readable. Intended for debugging purposes only.
        Parameters:
        stats - the data to be stringify
        datapath - the data path part of the original URI (e.g., table name, *.csv, etc.)
        Returns:
        the stringified data

      • getFragmentsNumber

        public long getFragmentsNumber()
        Returns number of fragments for a given data source.
        Returns:
        number of fragments

      • getFirstFragmentSize

        public FragmentsStats.SizeAndUnit getFirstFragmentSize()
        Returns the size in bytes of the first fragment.
        Returns:
        first fragment size (in byte)

      • getTotalSize

        public FragmentsStats.SizeAndUnit getTotalSize()
        Returns the total size of a given source. Usually it means the aggregation of all its fragments size.
        Returns:
        total size
